title.rendered: Explore Job Roles: Home Health and Personal Care Aides

content.rendered:
What are Home Health and Personal Care Aides?

Home Health and Personal Care Aides are people that help their ill or disabled patients with daily living tasks.

Where do Home Health and Personal Care Aides work?

  • Home healthcare services
  • Individual and family services
  • Assisted living facilities

How much do Home Health and Personal Care Aides make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for Home Health and Personal Care Aides is $26,000.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Home Health and Personal Care Aides?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing this career path.

  • Health science majors
  • Social work majors
Search Home Health and Personal Care Aide jobs

Home Health and Personal Care Aide skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Home Health and Personal Care Aides succeed in their work:

  • Compassion and patience
  • Good interpersonal skills
  • Detail oriented

What are some common questions about Home Health and Personal Care Aides?

Q: Do home health aides need to be licensed?

A: Yes.
